videos.title: Single Video File
videos.description: Pick a suitable video format to make sure your single media file can be played by a vast majority of browsers and players on the web.

videos.title: The Universal Source
videos.description: Encode your streams in a universal format to ensure your media can be served using both the DASH and HLS protocols.

categories.name: HTML
categories.description: Use the HTML <video> element to play back a single video file on the web. Alternatively, provide multiple sources and let the browser choose.

categories.name: Streaming
categories.description: Video streaming allows a more granular control of video playback by slicing a single video file into a sequence of independent chunks. DASH and HLS are the two main techniques used to describe a structure of a video stream.
